data.title: Carroll County, GA
data.meta_description: Carroll county, GA local info. Carroll county has 111,872 residents in 2010-2014, ranked #21 in Georgia. Also Carroll county races, income, school, weather, environment and other info / rankings.
data.text:
Carroll County

Carroll county is located in northwest Georgia. Carroll county has 499.08 square miles of land area and 4.76 square miles of water area. As of 2010-2014, the total Carroll county population is 111,872, which has grown 28.19% since 2000. The population growth rate is much higher than the state average rate of 21.03% and is much higher than the national average rate of 11.61%. Carroll county median household income is $45,009 in 2010-2014 and has grown by 16.01% since 2000. The income growth rate is about the same as the state average rate of 16.28% and is much lower than the national average rate of 27.36%. Carroll county median house value is $115,600 in 2010-2014 and has grown by 23.90% since 2000. The house value growth rate is lower than the state average rate of 33.09% and is much lower than the national average rate of 46.91%. As a reference, the national Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation rate for the same period is 26.63%. On average, the public school district that covers Carroll county is close to the state average in quality. The Carroll county area codes are 678, 770.
